review_title: It's all about which unit you work in, in turn the nurses you work with.
job_title: RN ICU in Henderson, NV
pros: Amazing peers on the unit, and direct level management is amazing.
cons: Corporate management is all about the bottom line and employee moral doesn't matter

review_title: Great unit and a true genuine team mentality.
job_title: RN III ICU in Henderson, NV
pros: From my experience, I have seen a group of great nurses and managers who are constantly looking out for each other. If there are questions that one may have, there is no shortage of peers that are willing to help.
cons: The only con that I have seen is the current lack of CNAs that are scheduled per unit. The ones we do have are great. I would just prefer that we had more per unit. A good CNA is invaluable to the efficiency of a unit.

review_title: Use this as a stepping stone only
job_title: Phlebotomist in Henderson, NV
pros: The only pro is the insurance.
cons: The lab is losing phlebotomist by the handful because of management. The manager there lacks professionalism and respect for employees they do not favor. It’s a clique environment with the manager and leads. Human Resources will disregard your concerns, you are better off just putting in your 2 weeks. The hospital doesn’t have compassion or care about their employees safety. People with high school mentalities tend to stay there are okay with the lack of safety, and like micromanagement. Being employed by this hospital you are no longer regarded as a human but disposable. I have seen so many phlebotomist not come back and quit because of management. It’s a for profit hospital. Treat this place as a temporary job to gain experience not a long term stay.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Small hospital and brand new
cons: CEO and lack of adequate staffing

review_title: Not a safe job. Pay also sucks.
job_title: ER Tech in Henderson, NV
pros: Flexible per diem schedule. Cool coworkers for the most part.
cons: Really crappy pay, really crappy hospital “security” who don’t do anything to actually protect you. This hospital needs armed security who can’t actually act on violent patients. I saw way too many of my coworkers get life altering injuries and no one even bats an eye. Security never gets better. Staff get punished if a violent person gets hurt while being restrained LOL. Insane. Chronic unpunished laziness with techs and nurses is also a huge problem. Also night shift is a soap opera

job_title: Medical Assistant in Nashville, TN
pros: The best reasons are to bring in proficient safety, patient care and be adequate enough to assist all of your staff and patients.
cons: I’ve never lived there, so I don’t know

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Henderson, NV
pros: Newer hospital; good location; nicer patients
cons: Cheap CEO; no flexibility in growth; over work you for cheap pay; favoritism; profit over safety.

review_title: No employee appreciation, all about profit
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Henderson, NV
pros: 3 day a week hospital work schedule, only thing that keeps me here
cons: No employee appreciation, never staffed adequately, more concerned with hospital reviews and customer service than being able to properly prioritize your nursing tasks. High turnover, mediocre benefits, low pay.

review_title: WORST Hospital I Have Ever Worked At
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Henderson, NV
pros: Staff are friendly and help each other out when needed since they are all in that mess together. Health insurance is great as long as you pick the PPO.
cons:
Where do I begin? 

For a hospital that was built about 6 years ago, it is in TERRIBLE physical shape! Electrical outlet faceplates coming loose from the wall, used equipment, fading wall paint, flimsy formica doors, this hospital was obviously built with the cheapest material. At least the original building is. The newer tower seems to have better quality. 

Do not be fooled by Sam Kaufman, the CEO - he is not as friendly as he seems on promotional videos. The nursing staff is abused with higher than normal ratios. Intermediate care units staff nurses with 5 or more patient each, where the safe ratio should be 3:1. In the ICU expect to have 3 ventilated patients to 1 nurse due to short staffing. This understaffing is a patient safety issue and contributes to poor quality of care. Unit management is a revolving door, not to mention the core nursing staff. No advancement opportunities. Pay is below what other hospitals pay.

I would not send my dog to this hospital.

review_title: Not a great company to work for
job_title: ER Technician in Henderson, NV
pros: None that I can think of
cons: Pour Pay, low staffing, little support from leadership. Unsafe conditions.

review_title: It’s a job that will drain you here
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Henderson, NV
pros: Ok benefits, nice coworkers and nice facility.
cons: They are always low on staff, and management load you with patients. No raise and will take your pto if you get covid.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Henderson, NV
pros:
Easy access to location
Lots of overtime available 
Employee parking garage 
Newer facility 
Easy to communicate with providers via youcallMD
cons:
Always understaffed and unsafe patient ratios.
Always felt unsafe, leadership doesn’t look at acuity when arranging assignments.
Expected to take more patients than can handle. ICU ratio is 3:1. Med tele was 7:1 when I left.
Coworkers formed cliques, not always reliable.
CEO doesn’t care about employees or their concerns. 
Micromanaged. 
Not enough support from upper management.
Pulled off orientation early because of short-staffing.
Lowest paying hospital in the valley.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) in Henderson, NV
pros:
The nursing and support staff are great people
Alot of teamwork
cons:
Lowest paid hospital in the valley
Constant floating to other units (not float pool staff)
Constant unsafe patient/staff ratios

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Location easy to get to
cons: Cliquey management. Micro management out of this world. Write ups and brought into office for discipline for every little things. Lowest paid hospital in the valley. Always out ratio. Fellow nurses very cliquey. Coworkers lie to get ahead. It’s literally taken me over 2 years just to write this interview because this hospital left me THAT traumatized. This place is joust horrible to work at.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Henderson, NV
pros: Latest equipment, so that’s a plus.
cons: Management deliberately short-staffs the entire hospital, & it is unsafe.

cons: Unsafe working conditions, terrible management, Low pay

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: It’s a great place to work.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great coworkers, laid back environment.

review_title: Great staff, but leadership/administration is horrid
job_title: Registered Nurse in Henderson, NV
pros: The staff RNs, CNAs, and ancillary team members.
cons: You never get to complete orientation before they throw you on the floor to work. Unsafe patient-to-nurse ratios. Punitive work environment. Bickering and fighting within the rings of upper management. Lowest paying hospital in the Las Vegas Area.

job_title: Agency RN, Perdiem in Henderson, NV
pros:
Not strict to overtime (for a few minutes by 30min).
Super easy to parking anywhere.
cons: Short OT period in the hospital. Some manger tried to give only 4hours OT for a nurse(Agency, Traveler). Float a lot to another unit. No 24hrs staff. Only one NP during night shift. EMR is cerner (I love EPIC). Most of them are friendly to new nurse except ER side.

job_title: ICU RN in Henderson, NV
pros: Nice hospital. Clean and new so equipment still works. Employees are nice.  ICU APRNs are amazing.
cons: Always understaffed. This is not a pandemic issue it’s a chronic one.  Orientations are non-existent due to this.  ICU intensivists (Doctors) are lazy and have tunnel vision about getting patients off ventilators.

job_title: Med Tech in Las Vegas, NV
pros: You will be treated there wors then in fast food industry
cons: This company don't care about their employees

job_title: Registered Nurse in Henderson, NV
pros: long training program for new grads. great team culture on my unit. very flexible schedule. great ancillary staff and docs. easy to page docs with youcallmd. open door management policy
cons: lack of autonomy. very corporatized medicine in terms of flow of the hospital and medical protocols.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV

job_title: Registered Nurse in Henderson, NV
pros: Henderson hospital has worked hard to create an amazing culture. It is stands out among all the other healthcare organizations in the Las Vegas Valley. Patient care is priority, the atmosphere is healing, and staff education is encouraged.
cons: Rapid growth and changing demographics have created new challenges that are currently being addressed. As additional projects are started, it will be important to maintain the culture in each service line.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Henderson, NV
pros: Depending on the unit: Unit director approachable. Most charge nurses and co-workers helpful.
cons: HR generalist is extremely unprofessional and discriminates. Patient to nurse ratio high. They make you sign a hefty contract. If you break contract they threaten to send you to collections if you don't pay thousands of dollars within 30 days.

job_title: OR Clinical Supervisor in Henderson, NV
